title: Settings for enable Web Proxy Auto-Discovery (WPAD) when configured to use system proxy settings ("network.proxy.system_wpad")
content:
Are there any plans to make configuration of the setting "network.proxy.system_wpad" available via ADMX (grouppolicy under Windows)? We need to deploy this to 100 computers ans I still have no idea how.

Feature was introduced in FF 125: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-enterprise-125-release-notes We currently use 128.4.0esr.

Thanks, Torsten.
creator: tjacobs42

title: Auto updating in stages
content: Hi, I am in a company where there is 100 and more devices with firefox on it. Right now we are facing a problem where some of it are using version way back into the days such as version 100 115 117 and such. We enabled auto updating but it only updates to version 127 whereas the latest version is 132. We are required to open firefox again for multiple time b4 it gets the latest version. Is there any way to jump those stages and straight updates to the latest version?
creator: lucaslau051011

title: default file save location
content:
I save pictures from Facebook and X from mostly relatives. Right click>Save Image as. It defaults to "C:\Users\bradb\OneDrive\Desktop" no matter what I set as folder in Settings>Files and Applications. I don't use OneDrive and removed the App. That caused my desktop to have only one icon, the Recycle Bin. I cancelled sync. How do I get the default to be "C:\Users\bradb\Desktop". 

    I really don't want to open File Explorer and work my way down to the OneDrive desktop folder every time to move the pictures to the proper storage folder on my NAS.     Rysen 5 HP tower Windows 11.     I think a Windows update started this.
creator: bradburymars

title: how can i refund my airtel wrong recharge?
content:
To request a refund for a wrong recharge on Airtel, you can follow these steps:

1. Contact Customer Care: You can call Airtel customer care at 630-3761-603 from your Airtel number or visit their official website for support options.

2. Visit the Airtel Store: You can also visit the nearest Airtel store and explain your situation to the staff there.

3. Use the Airtel App: If you have the Airtel app, you can go to the 'Help' section and look for options related to refunds or wrong recharges.

Make sure to have your transaction details handy, including the mobile number, amount, and date of the recharge. Refunds are subject to Airtel's policies, so results may vary.
creator: sheemakumari317

title: Firefox won't open on non-admin account, Mac OS
content:
I can open Firefox and it works fine on my (admin) user account, as it has for years.

Starting today, when my wife is logged in on her account/user on the Mac, when trying to open Firefox there is a prompt "Firefox is trying to install a new helper tool" and requests the admin name and password. I authorized yes to install the helper tool, and then the Firefox icon bounces on the dock indefinitely and Firefox is "not responding" and never opens. If I force quit and try again, I get the same prompt to install the helper tool and the cycle begins again.

I think this started after I updated a BitWarden extension on Firefox on my wife's account, but not sure if that is what provoked the problem. The same Bitwarden extension exists on Firefox on the admin account, and that Firefox works fine.

What I have tried so far: Shut down all BitWarden apps. Refreshed Firefox on the admin account - which deletes the BitWarden extension. Moved Firefox to the trash. Restart the computer. Re-install Firefox from the admin account (Firefox again works just fine when admin is the user). But Firefox still does not work when another user (my wife) is on her account - same issue with asking to install a helper tool and Firefox never opens.

Hardware: MacBook Air M2, Seqouia 15.1

Any help is much appreciated.
creator: evans.jeffreya

title: Microsoft just had an update for Edge
content:
Microsoft Edge just had an update and now when I turn on laptop I hear audio then when I go to task bar and click on the audio the pop up appears and on top of the standard pop up there is a video playing and shows the Microsoft Edge icon. How do I get rid of that crap? How do I disable it? I cannot watch any video without having the Edge audio blasting over the videos I want to watch. Ugg microsoft is horrible and Edge stinks.

Help please Gary

title: How to Disable "Click" Sound Effect In Firefox and Thunderbird?
content:
Firefox version 132.0.1 Thunderbird version 128.4.0esr O/S: PCLinuxOS Debian Edition (Debian 12 Bookworm) with KDE 5

I am getting a "Click" sound effect when I click Menu Bar items in both Firefox and Thunderbird, Bookmarks in Firefox, Folders in Thunderbird and some other items in both. I can not find a way to turn it off. It does not happen in any other applications, including other web browsers that are forked from Firefox, so I think it is a Mozilla problem.

This is a relatively new installation that was set up copying settings from Firefox on Windows 10 using Firefox Sync. I did not copy anything from Windows Thunderbird because my email is IMAP which brings in everything from the server. I am not getting this clicking sound in Windows Firefox and Thunderbird.

I am GUESSING that the sound effect is due to an Accessibility setting that is buried somewhere, maybe in one of the text-based "about...." configuration files, but I don't know where to look. I have gone through the Linux KDE System Settings and the Settings in Firefox and Thunderbird several times trying to find it. I will note that I set up Firefox and Thunderbird in the same Linux distro on a laptop also using Firefox Sync and do not have this problem with the laptop. Can anyone tell me where to look to get rid of this irritating noise?

Thank You!
creator: dmarshall1951

title: Lost Tab history
content:
My computer restarted on me (as always, this piece of garbage new laptop has to restart every other day for some stupid update or battery issue) and Firefox, despite still knowing my history and latest websites visited, does not have an option to open the many closed tabs.

I don't want to go back to Chrome, but there's basically only one thing I need from a browser and it's insurance against my devices turning off and leaving me without any of my tabs.

title: Capcha won't work
content: Until recently I had no problem with Captcha. Now I do, and it seems connected to recent Firefox update. I have repeatedly reported broken site to FF. I am able to log into the same accounts (such as The Guardian) on Google Chrome, but not on Firefox. I prefer Firefox because it is easier for me to read and navigate. I have read all the help and community articles and none work. Several community members mention that Google has owned Captcha since spring 2024. Has it made additional changes? Are you working with them to resolve this issue? I want to keep using Firefox but this is frustrating. I'll admit I have never liked Captcha, and wish someone would come up with a better option for it.
